meta.title: Home - Manassas Park City Schools

span.span: One Park Center Ct. Suite A

input.name: q
input.title: search
input.style: width: 100%; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: -0.0625em 0px 0px; height: 1.25em; outline: none;

div.h1: MPCS buildings will be closed until July 1, 2020

section.class: fsElement fsNews fsSlideshow fsItemCount_20 fsSlideshowHorizontal fsThumbnailOriginal fsThumbnailMedium

img.alt: Lockheed Martin Boosts MPCS Distance Learning Program

div.a: Lockheed Martin Boosts MPCS Distance Learning Program

div.p: Lockheed Martin donated $10,000 to BELL, the Education Foundation of Manassas Park, to directly support MPCS student learning during school closures.

article.a: Read more about Lockheed Martin Boosts MPCS Distance Learning Program

img.alt: Graf Named MPCS Teacher of the Year

div.a: Graf Named MPCS Teacher of the Year

div.p: Manassas Park City Schools has named Christine Graff this year's Teacher of the Year. Ms. Graf, a Math teacher at Manassas Park High School, will represent MPCS in the Washington Post Teacher of the Year competition.

article.a: Read more about Graf Named MPCS Teacher of the Year

img.alt: School Board Suspends Superintendent Search

div.p: The Manassas Park City Schools School Board today announced it will suspend its search for a new Superintendent of Schools.The School Board began its search in February after accepting Dr. C. Bruce McDade's letter of retirement.
School Board Chair Debbie McIntyre-Yurkovich said that the immediate future created by COVID-19 with subsequent closures and travel restrictions are the main factors in their decision.

"As a board, the decision to suspend our search for a superintendent was made to ensure the safety of everyone involved in the hiring process," said McIntyre-Yurkovich. "We want to hire the best possible candidate for MPCS, and the Board feels that our ability to do that is significantly hindered in this current environment."

p.strong: McDade Asked to Remain for 2020-2021 School Year

article.a: Read more about School Board Suspends Superintendent Search

img.alt: Manassas Park School Board Announces Superintendent Search

div.a: Manassas Park School Board Announces Superintendent Search

div.p: The Manassas Park School Board announced that it will take the next step in the process of hiring a new superintendent by seeking public input on qualifications.
The school board has created a survey related to superintendent criteria, which is available at https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/ManassasPark and on the division web site and its social media channels.

article.a: Read more about Manassas Park School Board Announces Superintendent Search

img.alt: MPCS Superintendent Announces Retirement

div.p: The Manassas Park City School Board last night accepted the retirement of Dr. C. Bruce McDade as Superintendent of Schools. Dr. McDade has been with MPCS for nearly 20 years serving 10 of those years as Superintendent. His current contract expires on June 30, 2020.

article.a: Read more about MPCS Superintendent Announces Retirement

img.alt: MPCS Senior Named 2020 National Merit Finalist

div.a: MPCS Senior Named 2020 National Merit Finalist

div.p: Senior Ryan Elam of Manassas Park High School has been named a Finalist in the National Merit Scholarship Program.

article.a: Read more about MPCS Senior Named 2020 National Merit Finalist

img.alt: ASBO Awards MPCS for Excellent Budget Presentation

div.a: ASBO Awards MPCS for Excellent Budget Presentation

div.p: January 9, 2020 – The Association of School Business Officials International (ASBO) is proud to recognize Manassas Park City Schools for excellence in budget presentation with the Meritorious Budget Award (MBA) for the 2019–2020 budget year.

article.a: Read more about ASBO Awards MPCS for Excellent Budget Presentation

img.alt: MPCS Seniors Named Commended Students in the National Merit Scholarship Program

div.a: MPCS Seniors Named Commended Students in the National Merit Scholarship Program

div.p: Manassas Park High School seniors Fahad A. Mohammed and Duc-Lo Nguyen have been named Commended Students in the 2020 National Merit Scholarship Program.

article.a: Read more about MPCS Seniors Named Commended Students in the National Merit Scholarship Program

img.alt: MPCS Senior Named 2020 National Merit Semifinalist

div.a: MPCS Senior Named 2020 National Merit Semifinalist

div.p: Ryan Elam of Manassas Park High School has been named a Semifinalist in the National Merit Scholarship Program.

article.a: Read more about MPCS Senior Named 2020 National Merit Semifinalist

img.alt: English Classes Available at MPCC

div.p: English classes will again be available at the Manassas Park Community Center. Since 2016 Manassas Park City Schools and BEACON for Adult Literacy have partnered together to bring these classes to the community.

article.a: Read more about English Classes Available at MPCC

img.alt: MPCS MySchoolBucks

div.p: This convenient online payment service provides a quick and easy way to pay for school-related purchases. You can now pay for items such as meal payments, technology fee, field trips, PE uniforms, and more using your credit/debit card or electronic check.

article.a: Read more about MPCS MySchoolBucks

img.alt: MPHS Teacher Finalist for Presidential Award for Excellence

div.a: MPHS Teacher Finalist for Presidential Award for Excellence

div.p: Colin Bouchillon was named a state-level finalist for the Presidential Award for Excellence in Mathematics and Science Teaching. Bouchillon, an 8-year veteran of Manassas Park High School, is one of three state finalists for Science. This prestigious award recognizes teachers that have deep content knowledge of the subjects they teach as well as the ability to motivate and enable students to be successful in those areas.

article.a: Read more about MPHS Teacher Finalist for Presidential Award for Excellence

img.alt: MPCS Graduates Receive Over $1M in Scholarships

div.a: MPCS Graduates Receive Over $1M in Scholarships

div.p: The largest graduating class in Manassas Park City Schools' history celebrated academic achievement and scholarship awards during the 2019 Annual Honors Assembly, Thursday, June 6.

article.a: Read more about MPCS Graduates Receive Over $1M in Scholarships

img.alt: Presentation Recording

div.p: This spring, Manassas Park City Schools hosted it's first Substance Use Prevention Use Night at the MP Community Center in conjunction with many local agencies. The presentation was captured on video and is now available for viewing.

article.a: Read more about Presentation Recording

img.alt: MPCS Finance Director Receives Highest Award

div.a: MPCS Finance Director Receives Highest Award

div.p: Krista Kelly, MPCS Executive Director of Financial Services, has received the 2019 Virginia Cardinal Award from the Virginia Association of School Business Officials (VASBO).

Announced at today's Spring VASBO conference in Norfolk, the Virginia Cardinal Award is VASBO's premier recognition given to one of its members each year for exemplifying professionalism, leadership, and innovation in the field of school business management.

article.a: Read more about MPCS Finance Director Receives Highest Award

img.alt: MPCS Among First in Innovation Network

div.a: MPCS Among First in Innovation Network

div.p: Manassas Park City Schools was one of 31 divisions meeting last week to share ideas on how to accelerate innovation and promote deeper learning in Virginia's public schools. Part of the first cohort of the Virginia is for Learners Innovation Network, MPCS was among the leaders in education innovation.

article.a: Read more about MPCS Among First in Innovation Network

div.p: Manassas Park City Schools has named this year's Teacher and Principal of the Year. Mr. George Valletti III, a teacher at Manassas Park Elementary School, was named Teacher of the Year, and Principal Pamela Kalso of Manassas Park High School was named Principal of the Year.

article.a: Read more about Congratulations!

img.alt: All MPCS Schools Fully Accredited

div.p: The Virginia Department of Education (VDOE) released results of Standards of Learning (SOL) assessments taken by students during the 2017-2018 school year, and Manassas Park City Schools exceeded state averages in most individual categories.

Dr. Bruce McDade, Superintendent of Manassas Park City Schools, said, "I am pleased to see that of the 35 reporting categories published today, MPCS met or exceeded the state pass rate in 21 of them. I am equally pleased that when final state accreditation ratings are released next month, all Manassas Park City Schools will be once again fully accredited."

article.a: Read more about All MPCS Schools Fully Accredited

img.alt: Get Connected!

div.p: The PowerSchool Parent Portal allows parents to view their child's schedule, grades and attendance. Parents are able to view assignment and attendance details, manage email notifications about their child's progress as well as communicate with their child's teachers.

article.a: Read more about Get Connected!
